bug.author: apivovarov
bug.summary: Pytorch .pth files can not be converted
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
A common PyTorch convention is to save models using either a .pt or .pth file extension. I have .pt model file which can be successfully converted. If I change its extension to .pth then I get the following error <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/_converters_entry.py", line 310, in convert **kwargs File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/mil/converter.py", line 134, in _convert prog = frontend_converter(model, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/mil/converter.py", line 84, in __call__ return load(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/mil/frontend/torch/load.py", line 49, in load torchscript = _torchscript_from_model(model_spec) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/mil/frontend/torch/load.py", line 100, in _torchscript_from_model type(model_spec) TypeError: @model must either be a PyTorch .pt file or a TorchScript object, received: <class 'str'> </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import torch import torchvision.models as models model = models.mobilenet_v2() eval = model.eval() example_input = torch.rand(1, 3, 224, 224) model = torch.jit.trace(model, example_input) model_file="/tmp/mobilenet_v2.pth" # ct.convert works fine for .pt but not for .pth model.save(model_file)
import coremltools as ct shape = ct.Shape(shape=(1,3,224,224)) inputs=[ct.TensorType(shape=shape)] ct.convert(model_file, inputs=inputs, source="pytorch") </denchmark-code>
The example works fine if .pth is changed to .pt <denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version (e.g., 3.0b5): 4.0b3 OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): Linux macOS version (if applicable): XCode version (if applicable): How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.7 any other relevant information:
torch 1.5.1
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting this issue. This has been fixed in . See: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/blob/master/coremltools/converters/mil/frontend/torch/load.py#L92>https://github.com/apple/coremltools/blob/master/coremltools/converters/mil/frontend/torch/load.py#L92</denchmark-link>
